dmca.title: FW: DCMA violation by simplycellphone.com
dmca.body:
Are you stating that you are refusing to investigate this matter further
because I am not giving you a strict notification procedure or are you
stating that, while my notice to you does not strictly comply with the
notification requirements under the DCMA, you will investigate the merits of
my claim?

I am hopeful we can resolve this situation informally rather than have me
certify to your agent of process of a violation my copyright under the DCMA.


On 7/14/06, Copyright <Copyright@theplanet.com> wrote:
>
>   To Whom It May Concern:
>
>
>
> Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
> substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
> Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").
>
>
>
> Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
> claim.
>
>
>
> Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
>
>
>
> Legal Response Team
>
> THEPLANET.COM <http://theplanet.com/> INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
>
>  ------------------------------
> *From:* Philip Liu [mailto:pliu12@gmail.com]
> *Posted At:* Friday, July 14, 2006 10:03 AM
> *Posted To:* Legal Response
> *Conversation:* DCMA violation by simplycellphone.com
> *Subject:* DCMA violation by simplycellphone.com
>
> I am the owner of www.cellphonenews.net.  Recently, I learned that my
> copyright has been violated by a domain hosted by theplanet.com.
> Specifically, www.simplycellphone.com has reprinted, without permission
> and without attribution, a posting by me in its entirety at:
> http://www.simplycellphone.com/index.php/simply-cell-phone/sprints-big-improvement-with-power-vision.htm
as
> well as at www.simplycellphone.com.
>
> The original posting on my site is:
http://www.cellphonenews.net/archives/2006/07/sprints_big_improvement_with_power_vision.php
> .
>
> I am hereby giving you notice as provided under the DCMA, as host of
> www.simplycellphone.com, to cause this DCMA violation to cease and desist
> immediately.  Please acknowledge the actions you have taken or will take to
> address this matter immediately.
>
> Sincerely,
> Philip Liu
> Phone: 917-667-8635
> Email: pliu12@gmail.com
>
